meanings.definition: People who are fortunate or lucky.
meanings.sent1: The fortunates won the lottery and celebrated with their friends.
meanings.sent2: The fortunates in the community always seemed to have good luck on their side.
meanings.sent3: The fortunates found a four-leaf clover and joked about being even luckier now.
meanings.sent4: Among the crowd of students, the fortunates shone like bright stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The fortunates' smiles lit up the room, spreading joy to everyone around them.

meanings.sent1: The fortunates individual always seemed to have things go their way.
meanings.sent2: She felt like one of the fortunates when she found money in an old jacket.
meanings.sent3: The fortunates cat always managed to find the warmest spot in the house.
meanings.sent4: The fortunates flower in the garden bloomed brighter than all the others.
meanings.sent5: His fortunates charm seemed to attract good luck wherever he went.
